Player History
Drafted in 1st round, 1st overall pick, by Syracuse in 1962...
Had first career hit on 4/8/1962, off Scott Balogh (CI)...
Hit first career homerun on 4/16/1962, off Dave Wulatin (CC)...
Won Player of the Week award on 9/22/1964, hitting .778 with 1 HR, 4 RBI...
Won Batter of the Month award on 10/1/1964, hitting .426 with 4 HR, 15 RBI...
Won Player of the Week award on 5/26/1967, hitting .444 with 2 HR, 3 RBI...
Was selected to the 1967 Allstar game...
Signed as a free agent by Lynchburg on 2/16/1968 to a 6-year deal worth $13,500,000 per year...
Drove in 6 runs against Pontiac on 4/16/1969...
Was selected to the 1970 Allstar game...
Was selected to the 1972 Allstar game...
Traded from Lynchburg to Wisconsin on 2/18/1973 (Going to LYN: LF J. Blizzard, P J. Theis, P W. Venne. Going to WIS: 1B G. Robbins, C E. Chicoine)...
Had 2000th career hit on 6/14/1974, off Shawn Falcone (Mal)...
Traded from Wisconsin to Pittsburgh on 2/18/1978 (Going to PIT: 1B G. Robbins. Going to WIS: P H. Plante)...
Won World Championship with Pittsburgh in 1978...
Signed as a free agent by Plum Grove on 2/2/1979 to a 3-year deal worth $7,475,000 per year...
Was selected to the 1979 Allstar game...
Had 3000th career hit on 9/8/1980, off George Brito (BC)...
Won Slick Fielder Award at First Base in 1980...
Won Slick Fielder Award at First Base in 1981...
